Recipe.title: Pizza
Recipe.Description: We have a family tradition of having home-made pizza every year on Halloween. This recipe is an adaptation of Dutch Oven and other Camping Recipes: Dutch Father's Pizza that Grandpa John invented for Dutch ovens, but modified so we can cook it indoors.

ingredient.name: Pineapple
ingredient.finePrint: Ransom thinks pineapple is a desecration on pizza, but his kids forced him to include it.

section.title: Crust
section.instruction: Mix Sugar into Water, then add Yeast.
When Yeast begins to foam, add all other ingredients and knead for 10 minutes.
Put in greased bowl, cover and let rise until doubled. (About 30 minutes.)

section.title: Assembling
section.instruction: Cut off a piece of dough about the size of your fist. (Slightly larger if you like a softer crust, slightly smaller if you like a crisper crust.)
Roll dough out into a 12-inch circle.
Put dough onto a cookie sheet.
Cookie sheet should either be greased or sprinkled with corn meal.
You can use a pie tin instead of a cookie sheet if you make them a little smaller.
Cover crust with sauce (See recipe for Sauces: Marinara Sauce.)
Add the toppings desired. It usually works best to do a little cheese, then other ingredients, then more cheese. Pepperoni can go on the very top.
Remove from oven, let sit for 2 minutes, then cut and serve.

Notes.note: For Gluten Sensitive people, check out: Entrees / Oven: Gluten-Free Pizza Crust
If time is short, you can just buy a simple spaghetti sauce to use for the pizza sauce, but if you do, don't get chunky sauce because it is hard to spread evenly over the crust.
Use left-over sauce as a dipping sauce for the pizza crusts.
